definition: Restraining, unifying, coalescing; gathering the scattered senses into one direction. Not suppression but unified direction.
Yoked, united; one who has accomplished yoga; the conquered mind. The mind yoked to Īśvara, neither scattered nor grasping.
Having Me (mat-) as the highest/ultimate (paraḥ); single-pointed devotion. Intent on Kṛṣṇa as the exclusive goal.
Well-founded, established, rooted; wisdom becomes stable like a tree with deep roots. Not fleeting insight but founded understanding.
Contemplating, the mind's scanning function; first step in the chain of entanglement. Without redirection toward puruṣa, defaults to viṣaya.
Attachment, binding; from saṅj 'to join'; the merge point where buddhi fuses with prakṛti instead of reflecting puruṣa.
Desire, lust; from kam 'to wish'; the extension of saṅga into active seeking—the process spawning beyond control.
Anger; from kru 'to be crooked'; the ego's defense when desire is frustrated. Arises when kāma is obstructed.
Perfect delusion, complete bewilderment; total loss of orientation in matter. The mirror shaken by tremors.
Bewilderment of memory; the native memory of spiritual identity becomes distorted. Forgetting who you are.
Destruction of intelligence; the collapse of buddhi's capacity to reflect puruṣa. The CPU is fried.
Is lost, falls; the terminal state of the kleśa cascade. Like gravity—operates whether one is aware or not.
Attachment, coloring toward; from raj 'to color'. The tendency to grasp at pleasant objects; attraction in the guṇa matrix.
Aversion, repulsion; from dviṣ 'to hate'. The tendency to push away unpleasant objects; rejection in the guṇa matrix.
Liberated, free from; vi-mukta—completely released from the binding force. Not suppression but transcendence.
Under self-control; the ātma as commander, not prisoner. Self-mastery through regulation, not will-power.
Grace, mercy, serene clarity; from pra-sad 'to settle down, become clear'. The settled state of citta when vṛtti ceases.
